H0.text: Ice has a definite volume but takes the shape of the container when placed in a container at room temperature.

H1.text: Copper is the substance that, when placed in a container at room temperature, has a definite volume but takes the shape of the container.

H2.text: Water has a definite volume but adopts the shape of its container when placed in a container at room temperature.

H3.text: Wood has a definite volume but takes the shape of the container when placed in a container at room temperature.

A4.text: A liquid is a nearly incompressible fluid that conforms to the shape of its container but retains a (nearly) constant volume independent of pressure.

A5.text: In a solid, the particles are tightly packed and held in fixed positions, giving the material a definite shape and volume.
